newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France drains 100 mln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France drains 100 mln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France drained 100 million francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Monday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Tuesday.
It accepted bids for 33.8 billion francs in new liquidity, 100 million less than the 33.9 billion leaving the market on Tuesday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on November 26.
The Bank of France said it allocated 10.0 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 2.7 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 23.8 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 10.3 percent of this demand.
